sentence.Network_en: Seen from afar, its towering buildings beckon the visitor in.
sentence.Network_cn: 从远处看，它高耸的大楼召唤着拜访者进去。

sentence.Network_en: The bright lights of Hollywood beckon many.
sentence.Network_cn: 好莱坞的花花世界吸引了很多人。

sentence.Network_en: All the attractions of the peninsula beckon.
sentence.Network_cn: 半岛上的各处景点无不令人心驰神往。

When love beckons you , follow him ., 当爱召唤你时 , 跟随他.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English  bīecnan, bēcnan, of West Germanic origin; related to beacon

entry.def: If you beckon to someone, you signal to them to come to you.
If something beckons, it is so attractive to someone that they feel they must become involved in it.

example.ex: All the attractions of the peninsula beckon...
example.tran: 半岛上的各处景点无不令人心驰神往。

example.ex: The bright lights of Hollywood beckon many.
example.tran: 好莱坞的霓虹灯吸引着很多人。

entry.def: If something beckons for someone, it is very likely to happen to them.

example.ex: The big time beckons for him...

means.word_mean: 1. signal with the hands or nod;
3. summon with a wave, nod, or some other gesture

auth_sentence.content: His clever eyes could beckon like a port.
auth_sentence.res_content: His clever eyes could beckon like a port.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: His clever eyes could beckon like a port.

auth_sentence.content: From there, the Oort clouds of other systems will beckon.
auth_sentence.res_content: From there, the Oort clouds of other systems will beckon.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: From there, the Oort clouds of other systems will beckon.

auth_sentence.content: There is a glorious open-air lobby to beckon the public inside.
auth_sentence.res_content: There is a glorious open-air lobby to beckon the public inside.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: There is a glorious open-air lobby to beckon the public inside.

means.word_mean: (用头或手的动作)示意, 召唤

sentences.en: He beckoned me to come nearer.

jushi.chinese: 克劳斯兴奋地向他招手示意。

jushi.english: He beckoned with his left hand.
On the Pacific Coast promised lands beckoned.
jushi.chinese: 太平阳沿岸欣欣向荣的土地在吸引人们。
